intro: Papaver lamjungense, commonly known as the Lamjung poppy, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan region of Nepal. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its striking, vibrant flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky, alpine environments at high elevations. Its flowers have four to six petals and are surrounded by a prominent, saucer-shaped calyx. Papaver lamjungense is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to high-altitude conditions.
